title: Population of regions in England in 2018
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of inhabitants (in millions) for 9 number of Regions.
Region South East has the highest Number of inhabitants (in millions) and North East has the lowest Number of inhabitants (in millions).
The difference of Number of inhabitants (in millions) between the highest and lowest Region is 6.47.
min_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in each Region on the y axis.
Region South East has the highest Number of inhabitants (in millions) and North East has the lowest Number of inhabitants (in millions).
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of inhabitants (in millions) for 9 number of Regions.
Region South East has the highest Number of inhabitants (in millions) and North East has the lowest Number of inhabitants (in millions).
The difference of Number of inhabitants (in millions) between the highest and lowest Region is 6.47.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Region in the x axis and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in the y axis.
Region South East has the highest Number of inhabitants (in millions) and North East has the lowest Number of inhabitants (in millions).
Second maximum Number of inhabitants (in millions) is found at Region London.
The difference of Number of inhabitants (in millions) between the highest and lowest Region is 6.47.
Number of inhabitants (in millions) at Region South East is 9.13 , second place is London at 8.9, and thirdly is North West at 7.29.
The Region North East has 1.47 times less Number of inhabitants (in millions) than average.
Summing up the values of all Regions, we get total 55.92.
